alert.note: Alert for Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 1:29PM CDT until April 18 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Minnesota, including the following county, Traverse. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area due to snow melt. Flooding is already occurring. - For the city of Dumont, continued runoff will lead to continued rises along the West Branch of Twelve Mile Creek through Saturday morning to early afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wheaton, Browns Valley, Dumont, Tintah, Mud Lake Landing, Collis, Silver Bridge, Immanuel Church, Siloah Country Church, Halls Landing, Trinity Lutheran Country Church, Rainbow Island, Lake Traverse, Traverse Country Park and northeastern Lake Traverse Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
